bwwExcerpt: No, the making of this musical feels like a good, old fashioned cash grab; an opportunity to capitalize on the sentimentality of the same people who can't hear Orbison's song without seeing Julia Roberts and Richard Gere and who helped turn Pretty Woman into the fourth highest-grossing film in the United States in 1990. Evidence to this effect can be found in the libretto (written by the film's director, Garry Marshall, and its writer, J.F. Lawton). It sticks so closely to the screenplay - we're
